hints.content:
Let's put our numbers into a place value table.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
- | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\maroonD{632}$ |  $\maroonD6$ | $\maroonD3$ | $\maroonD2$
$\blueE{75}$ |  | $\blueE7$ | $\blueE5$

Now, we can break apart each number by place value.

$\maroonD{632}=\maroonD{6\text{ hundreds}} + \maroonD{3\text{ tens}} + \maroonD{2\text{ ones}}$.  

$\blueE{75}= \blueE{7\text{ tens}}+ \blueE{5\text{ ones}}$.
$6\text{ hundreds} + 3 \text{ tens}+7 \text{ tens}+2 \text{ ones}+5\text{ ones}$ is the same as $632 + 75$.

question.content:
**What do we get when we break apart $632+75$ using place value?**
